verses.roman:
ei-mata rāsa-līlāya haya yata śloka
sabāra artha kare, pāya kabhu harṣa-śoka

synonyms: ei-mata—in this way; rāsa-līlāya—in the pastimes of the rāsa-līlā; haya—there are; yata śloka—as many verses; sabāra—of all of them; artha kare—He explains the meaning; pāya—gets; kabhu—sometimes; harṣa-śoka—happiness and lamentation.
translation: In this way, He explained the meaning of all the verses concerning the rāsa-līlā. Sometimes He would be very sad and sometimes very happy.
